bitfield.name: reserved
bitfield.description: Reserved

bitfield.name: extintSel
bitfield.description: EXTINT pin select (0=EXTINT0, 1=EXTINT1)

bitfield.name: extintWake
bitfield.description: EXTINT pin control (0=disabled, 1=enabled, keep receiver awake as long as selected EXTINT pin is 'high')

bitfield.name: extintBackup
bitfield.description: EXTINT pin control (0=disabled, 1=enabled, force receiver into BACKUP mode when selected EXTINT pin is 'low')

bitfield.name: reserved
bitfield.description: Reserved

bitfield.name: limitPeakCurr
bitfield.description: Limit peak current (00=disabled, 01=enabled, peak current is limited, 10=reserved, 11=reserved)

bitfield.name: waitTimeFix
bitfield.description: Wait for Timefix (0=wait for normal fix OK before starting on time, 1=wait for time fix OK before starting on time)

bitfield.name: updateRTC
bitfield.description: Update Real Time Clock (0=do not wake up to update RTC, 1=update RTC)

bitfield.name: updateEPH
bitfield.description: Update Ephemeris (0=do not wake up to update Ephemeris data, 1=update Ephemeris)

bitfield.name: reserved
bitfield.description: Reserved

bitfield.name: doNotEnterOff
bitfield.description: Behavior of receiver in case of no fix (0=receiver enters Inactive, 1=receiver does not enter Inactive but keeps trying to acquire a fix instead)

bitfield.name: mode
bitfield.description: Mode of operation (00=ON/OFF operation (PSMOO), 01=cyclic tracking operation (PSMCT), 10=reserved, 11=reserved)

bitfield.name: reserved
bitfield.description: Reserved

UBX-CFG-PM2.flags.notes: All 32 bits (0-31) of the X4 'flags' field are accounted for using the 'Bitfield flags' graphic and corresponding description tables on pages 2 and 3 of the document. Reserved bits are inferred from gaps in the specified bit ranges.

bitfield.name: lla
bitfield.description: Position is given in LAT/LON/ALT (default is ECEF)

bitfield.name: altInv
bitfield.description: Altitude is not valid, in case lla was set

bitfield.name: reserved
bitfield.description: Reserved

UBX-CFG-TMODE2.flags.notes: The graphic 'Bitfield flags' explicitly defines bits 0 and 1. The remaining bits (2-15) are implicitly reserved as the field is X2 (16 bits).

bitfield.name: DDC
bitfield.description: DDC/I2C

bitfield.name: UART1
bitfield.description: UART 1

bitfield.name: UART2
bitfield.description: UART 2

bitfield.name: USB
bitfield.description: USB

bitfield.name: SPI
bitfield.description: SPI

bitfield.name: reserved
bitfield.description: Reserved

UBX-CFG-TXSLOT.enable.notes: The bitfield graphic and associated table explicitly define bits 0-4. Bits 5-7 are implicitly reserved for an 8-bit (X1) field.

bitfield.name: combineTicks
bitfield.description: Use combined rear wheel-ticks instead of the single tick

bitfield.name: reserved
bitfield.description: Reserved

bitfield.name: reserved
bitfield.description: Reserved

bitfield.name: reserved
bitfield.description: Reserved

bitfield.name: useWtSpeed
bitfield.description: Use speed measurements (data type 11 in ESF-MEAS) instead of single ticks (data type 10)

bitfield.name: dirPinPol
bitfield.description: Only supported on certain products. Direction pin polarity: 0: High signal level means forward direction, 1: High signal level means backward direction.

bitfield.name: useWtPin
bitfield.description: Use wheel-tick pin for speed measurement.

bitfield.name: reserved
bitfield.description: Reserved

UBX-CFG-ESFWT.flags1.notes: All 8 bits (0-7) accounted for based on the 'Bitfield flags1' graphic and accompanying table.

bitfield.name: autoWtCountMaxOff
bitfield.description: Disable automatic estimation of maximum absolute wheel-tick counter value (0: enabled, 1: disabled). See wtCountMax field description for more details. (Not supported in protocol versions less than 19)

bitfield.name: autoDirPinPolOff
bitfield.description: Disable automatic wheel-tick direction pin polarity detection (0: enabled, 1: disabled). See dirPinPol field description for more details. (Not supported in protocol versions less than 19)

bitfield.name: autoSoftwareWtOff
bitfield.description: Disable automatic use of wheel-tick or speed data received over the software interface if available (0: enabled, 1: disabled). In this case, data coming from the hardware interface (wheel-tick pins) will automatically be ignored if wheel-tick/speed data are available from the software interface. See useWtPin field description for more details. (Not supported in protocol versions less than 19)

bitfield.name: autoUseWtSpeedOff
bitfield.description: No explicit description found in the accompanying table. Likely disables automatic use of speed measurements (similar to useWtSpeed in flags1).

bitfield.name: reserved
bitfield.description: Reserved

UBX-CFG-ESFWT.flags2.notes: The graphical representation for 'flags2' only explicitly defines bits 0-3. Bits 4-7 are assumed to be reserved to fulfill the 8-bit requirement of an X1 data type. An explicit description for 'autoUseWtSpeedOff' (bit 3) was not found in the accompanying table; its description is inferred from its name and context.
